case_data.name: EEOC v. NATIONAL RESTAURANT ENTERPRISES D/B/A AMERIKING CORPORATION
case_data.plaintiff_description: Equal Employment Opportunity Commission, on behalf of one or more workers.
case_data.summary: The EEOC Richmond office, in conjunction with the Washington, D.C. office, filed this suit on April 22, 2004 in the U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia against National Restaurant Enterprises, Inc. doing business as Ameriking Corporation. The complaint is unavailable. After seven months without a response by the defendant, the EEOC moved for a default judgment. The motion was granted in January 2005. The default judgment awarded the three named plaintiffs a total of 1,067,324.86.

documents.title: Judgment Order
documents.text:
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT
FOR THE EASTERN DISTRICT OF VIRGINIA
Richmond Division ........--~--~E=---~'
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
COMMISSION,
Plaintiff,
v. Civil Action No. 3:04cv274
NATIONAL RESTAURANT ENTERPRISES,
INC. d/b/a AMERIKING CORPORATION,
Defendant.
JUDGMENT ORDER
Having reviewed the Complaint filed herein (Docket No.1),
having been advised that the defendant, National Restaurant
Enterprises, Inc., d/b/a AmeriKing Corporation, has been served
with process and has filed no response having considered the Entry
l
of Default (Docket No.6) and the Equal Employment Opportunity
Commission/s Application for Default Judgment (Docket No.4), and
having considered the Equal Employment Opportunity's Memorandum
Regarding Damages (Docket No.8) and the attachments and exhibits
I
thereto and having concluded that, taken as a whole, the record
l
establishes that the defendant, National Restaurant Enterprises,
Inc., d/b/a AmeriKing Corporation at the times pertinent hereto,
l
engaged in unlawful employment practices in violation of 42 U.S.C.
§ 2000e-2, including subjecting Adiza Kay Lhuillier to sexual
harassment and to a hostile work environment based on her sex, the
